children.subject: Are these still going to come out today?
please email me directly, msun86@eecs.berkeley.edu

Hi Michael,

I sent an email (and a follow-up) to the EECS department grad admissions email about a document within my application. I never received a response, and I just want to make sure you received it.
Are decisions still being released on today (Monday)?
That is the plan, yes. The vast majority of departmental letters for admits will go out tonight, there are a few pending cases but we expect to resolve them within the day.
Awesome, thanks!
what about for rejection emails?
since there are a few pending cases, we will probably not formalize rejection decisions until the end of the week as these pending cases get resolved.
Is it possible to expect a result by the end of today, if we submitted by the 03/16 deadline? Thanks in advance.

Sorry to add to the comments, but @Michael is it possible to at least send rejections tonight to those who are concretely rejected and not still pending/in debate? This would minimize the amount of people who are still going to be sitting on the edge of their seats for the rest of the week. If possible, that would be very helpful!! Thank you for all your hard work. :)
I'll try..

Decisions will be sent out on Monday. The SIR deadline is a soft deadline, so admits will still have time to consider options and make a decision up until May 1st.

Best,

Michael
we all keeping track here. I haven't heard anything.
any updates?
I just received an acceptance.
released, thank you Michael and all admission committee involved.
Me too.
released
Acceptance out at 10:31PM Huge thanks to Micheal and the admissions team.

Just curious, has anyone here that received an acceptance not received the official offer letter yet? I saw some people posting in another thread that it's been sent out, but I haven't received one yet
Received It at 7:30 today
Can someone confirm here once they receive their decision?

It is true that this was indeed the goal of the admissions committee to get decisions finalized by early April. In the past admission cycles since I've been here at EECS, we've been able to meet this deadline (not related to early decisions, which is a different issue entirely). However with COVID-19 causing havoc, we allowed faculty extra time (an additional week) to submit their LORs for applicants who submitted on time. Then a week ago, I made this announcement to keep everyone abreast.

Thanks for your valued feedback.
Thank you to the admission committee for all your hard work! It just would've been nice to have a specific date
"Early April" indeed
Yes.
Is this still on track to releasing today?

Personally, I feel like my entire future depends on this decision.
Aside for it being a dream of mine to continue doing research for my advisor and take graduate classes, I have an internship this summer, so if I won't get into the program, it will probably be canceled since I won't be getting back to school. Full-time offer is currently not on the table.

I've been checking the online portal every day since Monday of last week, and the added pressure of the moving decision dates makes me distracted and far less productive with my school work.

Your work, along with the entire admission committee, is extremely appreciated, especially during these times. Thank you for all your hard work even though you, and the other members of the department, are outside of your comfort zone and normal working habits.

It must be noted, especially during these times of uncertainty, that clarity and transparency are things that we, the students, crave for. I feel like I need as much stability as I can, and dealing with not knowing when decisions are out and what is going on with my future is just plain stressful (and painful). And it should be stated that I'm 27 years old ex-military with a lot of experience with handling pressure, so I can only guess how other, "normal", students feel.

Hope I managed to convey my message clearly. Thanks again for everything you are doing. If you have any further updates, please keep us posted.
Nope, but apparently decisions are still coming out today.
its out
Has anyone heard of any updates?

Just got rejected. Can't really think of why as for now. I have 3.98/4.00 GPA(and some graduate coursework) and related research work. I do have a professor who is willing to sponsor my research. Has the program been this much selective recently??
yep. same here. not sure
Haven’t received any email too
@anonymous helix — how much research work did you do with the professor sponsoring your research? how popular is your professor?

I did switch to a different professor from my previous one because the Phd student who originally worked with me graduated last semester. But I think in the application website they didn't explicitly state that you have to work for the professor for a long time to get accepted. Also, my previous work is very related to what I am doing right now and the Phd student who is working with me seems to be satisfied with my work so far. This really puts me and my research advisor into some trouble since we are worrying about not being able to continue the work...

> they didn't explicitly state that you have to work for the professor for a long time to get accepted.

It's implicit that you need a strong relationship with the professor you work with, since they're the one who's supposed to advise you directly for your masters. You mention that your Phd student is satisfied with your work, which leads me to think that your professor (advisor) isn't that familiar with you and your work. 

Read:

@1623

@2094

And you will see clearly that most likely the reason you are rejected is exactly this point (prof not coming through / relationship not strong enough). Hope this was helpful to you, I understand it is tough to be rejected but you have to accept the reality.
Haven't received any email yet... Looks like many people have. Does that mean a rejection? I am very panic right now...
Just the ones who were deferred. The official offer will come from Graduate Divisions, but that process could not be initiated until regular deadline had passed/decisions finalized.
Were early admit applicants also supposed to get an email tonight?
What was the acceptance rate?

Hi Michael,

For people who haven’t received the decisions, are they in the few pending cases ? Thank you

history.content: We are aiming at getting out decisions by the end of the week for those who submitted applications by the regular deadline (March 16th). Admits will receive a departmental offer letter, followed by an official offer letter from Graduate Division at a later date (likely April 13th) as our recommendations take a bit of time to process through their admissions unit.
history.subject: EECS 5th Yr MS Decisions
